actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend title XVI of the Social Security Act to provide that a blind or disabled child otherwise qualified may be eligible for SSI benefits even though not a resident of the United States, if such child is accompanying a parent who is a member of the armed forces serving a tour of duty overseas.

summary.text: Amends title XVI (Supplemental Security Income) of the Social Security Act to provide that a blind or disabled child accompanying a parent in the Armed Forces stationed overseas may receive SSI benefits even though the child is not a U.S. resident.

titles.title: A bill to amend title XVI of the Social Security Act to provide that a blind or disabled child otherwise qualified may be eligible for SSI benefits even though not a resident of the United States, if such child is accompanying a parent who is a member of the armed forces serving a tour of duty overseas.
